body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @puneetlath **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [@migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1759512581456869) ## Action Performed: 1. Log in as a user in a Collect workspace 2. Navigate to Workspaces → Rules → confirm Rules section is unavailable 3. Create a new expense in NewDot 4. Observe that: The Reimbursable toggle is not shown 5. Expense is created as non-reimbursable 6. Submit and approve the report 7. Attempt to mark report as Paid. ## Expected Result: Collect workspaces should default all expenses to reimbursable (consistent with Classic), or Users should be able to toggle reimbursable status manually on expense creation. ## Actual Result: Expenses default to non-reimbursable, Reimbursable toggle is missing, Report cannot be marked Paid after approval. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

labels.name: External

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.2.22-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176877/test-cases/41237357 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** Applausetester+track1@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Redminote 10s android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Pre-condition: Have atleast one expense in existing workspace moved via share it with your accountant 1. Launch app 2. Login with expensifail account 3. Open self DM 4. Create a manual expense 5. Tap share it with accountant 6. Select a user 7. Select an existing workspace 8. Create expense 9. Note new expense created is shown in seperate report 10. Immediately open the expense 11. Note within seconds, expense disappears and "report has no expenses"is shown 12. Tap back and note new expense is added with first expense as same report ## Expected Result: Newly created expense should consistently remain in its own report, without disappearing or merging back with another report. ## Actual Result: The expense briefly appears in a separate report, disappears upon opening, shows “Report has no expenses”, and then re-merges with the first expense in the original report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/955bd675-d90b-4cb6-b4a1-fb26ec72c729 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
